thag2.18:1.1: A Prācīnavaṁśa was a hall or shed built for the ritual, with bamboo (vaṁsa) beams running easterly (prācīna; Śatapatha Brāhmaṇa 3.1.1.6 and Eggeling’s note).
thag2.18:1.2: This is a reference to MN 31:2.1 = MN 128:8.1, where Anuruddha, Kimbila, and Nandiya were practicing together in this grove.
